q: The bust dates to the time of the 14th century B.C. queen and tops Egypt's wish list of items that Zahi Hawass wants to see back home. The bust is at Berlin's Neues Museum. I am doing something that I believe in and that should have been done a hundred years ago, Zahi Hawass said in a telephone interview. Germany has declined past Egyptian requests for the bust's return, saying it was in Germany legally and is too fragile to move. Bombs kill Barack Obama troops

I've now scored 40 points on the highest stage you can ever score, said Linas Kleiza , whose previous career-high of 29 came March 15 against the Los Angeles Lakers. Googled Author Ken Auletta argues that the decision to pull Google( GOOG) out of China was the turning point for outgoing CEO Eric Schmidt in his decision to step down from the company's Chief Executive role. According to close advisors, the Google C.E.O. was upset a year ago when co-founder Larry Page sided with his founding partner, Sergey Brin , to withdraw censored searches from China. Eric Schmidt did not hide his belief that Google should stay in the world's largest consumer marketplace.... dome and tried to lower themselves using ropes. They fell on to a tomb, smashing its case and severing the heads of two mummies.Chief curator Zahi Hawass told how they then ransacked the souvenir shop. He said: These idiots missed the real treasure and stole from the gift shop instead. The Coptic Museum, Royal Jewellery Museum, National Museum of Alexandria and Mohamed ElBaradei Manial Museum have also been targeted. Mr Zahi Hawass said: "My heart is broken and my blood is boiling."

Coupled with expectations that North American sales volumes will grow by at least 1 million vehicles, they could easily generate closer to$ 2 billion in cash. The fact that Sergio Marchionne firmly defended the decision to pay hourly and salaried workers "performance awards" for the 2010 results indicates his confidence that the operating improvements will outpace the debt payments eventually.

runs the Neues Museum in the German capital where the bust is kept. "The foundation's position on the return of Nefertiti remains unchanged," foundation president Professor Hermann Parzinger said in a statement. She is and remains the ambassador of Egypt in Berlin. Egypt's antiquities chief, Zahi Hawass , appealed to the foundation seeking the return of the bust, famed for its almond-shaped eyes and swan-like neck. He also asserted Google must focus on the development of technology that allows people to use their phones to do financial transactions. Phones, as we know, are used as banks in many poorer parts of the world- and modern technology means that their use as financial tools can go much further than that, he wrote. Finally, Eric Schmidt said Google would like to make inexpensive smartphones available to the most destitute regions of the planet.
